ODM.Description: RPE - Surgery - Research Protocol Evaluation Tool

GlobalVariables.StudyName: RPE - Surgery - Research Protocol Evaluation Tool
GlobalVariables.StudyDescription: This file contains the metadata, events, and data for REDCap project "RPE - Surgery - Research Protocol Evaluation Tool".
GlobalVariables.ProtocolName: RPE - Surgery - Research Protocol Evaluation Tool
GlobalVariables.redcap:ProjectNotes: Used for the Department of Surgery Vice Chair of Research Dr. Susan Evans to evaluate the merit of research proposals submitted for funding

redcap:Surveys.title: Department of Surgery Research Protocol Evaluation Submission
redcap:Surveys.instructions:
The RPE is on hold during the Atrium Health and Wake Forest research integration. You will not need to submit new studies or continuing reviews through the RPE to obtain a department signature prior to IRB or IACUC submission.

However, there will be a department review process prior to submission of 1) research studies conducted by research residents and 2) studies funded by the Department of Surgery through the internal grants process. We will keep you updated as we develop this process. Please email Nicole.Kaiser@atriumhealth.org if this applies to one of your upcoming studies.

 

This form is provided by the Department of Surgery for research coordinators to submit initial protocol submissions and Continuing Reviews for departmental review of scientific merit. This applies to IRB, IACUC, and IBC studies. If left incomplete, your submission will not be reviewed.

You will receive an email notification once departmental review is complete. If approved by the department, you will be required to forward the notification email and all normally required documents to the Atrium Health IRB, IACUC, or IBC for review.

For studies that require a Business Unit and Department number for review fees, ensure this information is included in the Application.

Please allow 2-4 weeks for evaluation by the Department of Surgery.

COVID-19 Update: The Atrium Health IRB issued a temporary SOP regarding the suspension of written signature for IRB forms due to the coronavirus pandemic. Since the Department of Surgery already obtains electronic department approval of new studies and renewals, continue to submit through this form. However, to accommodate research teams who are unable to obtain the Investigator’s signature or scan files, teams can upload unsigned Word files of the protocol and application. It is expected that the Investigator has already approved the submission through the team’s internal communications before it is submitted to the RPE. Once you receive department approval, follow the IRB procedures in the temporary SOP when submitting to the IRB. The SOP, Temporary Suspension of Written Signatures, can be located on PeopleConnect’s Research site.
redcap:Surveys.acknowledgement:
Thank you for submitting your protocol. It will now undergo committee review in the order in which it was received.

If you have any questions, please contact:

Nicole Kaiser, Nicole.Kaiser@atriumhealth.org

or

Dr. Susan Evans, Susan.Evans@atriumhealth.org

Thank you!
redcap:Surveys.confirmation_email_subject: Your research protocol was successfully submitted to the Department of Surgery
redcap:Surveys.confirmation_email_content:
Thank you for submitting your proposed research protocol: [title]
You will be notified by email once the proposal is reviewed and a decision has been made by the Department of Surgery. Please expect 2-4 weeks for this to occur.

If you have any questions, please contact:

Nicole Kaiser, Nicole.Kaiser@atriumhealth.org

or

Dr. Susan Evans, Susan.Evans@atriumhealth.org

Thank you!
redcap:Surveys.response_limit_custom_text: Thank you for your interest; however, the form is closed because the maximum number of responses has been reached.

redcap:Surveys.title: RPE Document Reminder

redcap:SurveysScheduler.email_content:
Please open the link to view and acknowledge your message regarding your recently submitted research proposal [title].

Your proposal has the following status:
[status]

Acknowledge your receipt of this email via time stamp in the pop-up message. If the status is "Approved for submission: CHS Research to provide IRB funding", follow the pop-up message instructions to pay the IRB fees.

You may open the survey in your web browser by clicking the link below:
[survey-link]

If the link above does not work, try copying the link below into your web browser:
[survey-url]

This link is unique to you and should not be forwarded to others.

Please open the link to see your message regarding your recently submitted research proposal [title]
You may open the survey in your web browser by clicking the link below: [survey-link]
If the link above does not work, try copying the link below into your web browser: [survey-url]
This link is unique to you and should not be forwarded to others.

redcap:Reports.title: Studies by Score
redcap:Reports.description: Ranks studies from highest to lowest for studies that required the scoring process

redcap:RecordDashboards.title: Deferral List
redcap:RecordDashboards.description: Studies in idle phase. Review periodically during Steering Committee Meetings.

redcap:RecordDashboards.title: Needs Dr. Evans Review
redcap:RecordDashboards.description: Shows submissions that have not yet received department Chair/Chair designee review and evaluation. Does not include deferred studies.

redcap:RecordDashboards.title: Needs Dr. McKillop's Review
redcap:RecordDashboards.description: Shows submissions that have not yet received department review and evaluation. Does not include deferred studies.

redcap:Alerts.alert_title: Alert to Dr. Evans after Dr. McKillop's Review
redcap:Alerts.alert_message:
Hi Dr. Evans,

Record [record_id] has been reviewed by Dr. McKillop and is ready for your review/approval.

PI: [pi]

Study Title: [title]

Thank you.

redcap:Alerts.alert_message:
Record [record_id] has been approved by the Department of Surgery. Documentation should be sent to the IRB.

Question.TranslatedText: Proposal Status
The Department of Surgery will provide the following amount for this study:
CHS Research will provide the following amount for this study:

Attestation of Department Chair/Designee: By signing this form: I certify this study [title] went through a departmental scientific and quality review and is aligned with AH/Departmental priorities. I approve this study for submission to the AH IRB. I understand that the AH IRB manages Exempt determinations and Expedited reviews. Should this study require FULL BOARD review, it will be referred to an external IRB and will incur costs per the current negotiatied fee schedule. 
Department of Surgery agrees to pay the required $100 AH IRB review fee for this study unless otherwise arranged by Sponsored Programs Administration (e.g. federal funding, sponsored studies, etc.)
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:

I certify this study [title] went through a departmental scientific and quality review and is aligned with AH/Departmental priorities. I approve this study for submission to the AH IRB.

I understand that the AH IRB manages Exempt determinations and Expedited reviews. Should this study require FULL BOARD review, it will be referred to an external IRB and will incur costs per the current negotiatied fee schedule. 

Department of Surgery agrees to pay the required $100 AH IRB review fee for this study unless otherwise arranged by Sponsored Programs Administration (e.g. federal funding, sponsored studies, etc.)

Your project: [title]
This is a notification to inform you that your research project noted above has been evaluated by the Department of Surgery.
If the status of your proposal is approved for submission, you will need to forward this email along with all normally required IRB, IACUC, or IBC documents to [irb_coord] for review. Documentation of departmental review will be sent to the appropriate Review Board/Committee.
Thank you!

Question.TranslatedText:
Your project: [title]
This is a notification to inform you that your research project noted above has been evaluated by the Department of Surgery and is ready for you to submit to the IRB. You will need to forward this email along with all normally required IRB documents to [irb_coord] for IRB review. Documentation of departmental review will be sent to the IRB.
Because the Primary Author of this protocol is a Resident or Fellow, the IRB expenses will be covered by CHS Research. To pay the invoice from Chesapeake, enter a disbursement request to expense the IRB Department Account (12-260008-620970) and route to Jon Schwaiger. Include a descriptive note about the role of the resident/fellow.
Thank you!
